Set to High.
And changed requester to ITS operations (see email from Russ just received)

Already in the Volunteering section, needs to go on the rest of the site (and mascot splash page)  there is a tag at *both* the top and at the bottom of the page. 

~0.5 days

I've been adding the Chartbeat tags to all the templates since friday and i think I'm through all of them now. I've already published some parts but to be complete we'd need a complete website republish to make it work. Shall we do this maybe later on today? Or we could do it within the day publishing pages on low priority?

Happy for you to publish this tonight if that’s possible.

Russ, are you happy with this?
OK. We are holding off on this for now. ITS are introducing a new deployment process which needs to be put in place before this can go live. See http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1537

Lars: sorry you are having to undo the work you have just done. It's quite alright to charge for it, because this requirement is a new one that we were not warned about (well, we knew it was coming, but we didn't realise it would effect this piece of work).
Its alright, I had thought of this and now worked out a better way of doing it all together :)

Hi Danny – Do I have an account on this to see the tickets?

Russ

Russ Ede
Internet Technology Services

Hi Russ, your username is russ.ede and your password is whatever you set it as. If you cannot recall it, you should be able to request a new one via the login page. Let me know if you have any problems - danny

Ok – sorry – this is on the Kitsite CMS??

Russ

Russ Ede
Internet Technology Services

the logins for http://postcms.zendesk and http://new2012.kitsite.com are integrated, so you use the same login for both. 

Just follow the links on the ticket updates that you should be receiving by email from zendesk and then login from there.

I've been preparing the setup for Chartbeat tags in the Staging Environment.

I've created 2 containers ( one on the top and one at the end of each page ) which will allow easier handling of the statistic packages i.e. turning Chartbeat statistics on and off / changing codes / adding more of them etc... ~ without the need of a  site wide republish. Its quicker and cleaner and its done and functional after arepublish of the 2012 site.
It is likely that we will want to use Kieran's suggested "discreet staging" method for this, i.e. wrapping the code in a php conditional combined with the use a variable in the init.php file.
Awaiting setting up of staging environment and clearance from ITS.
is this sorted?

Russ says, "This is a content change that can be done under the BAU umbrella".

So, I think we can do this when you are ready.
Does Jag agree...
Yes. I believe so. We will proceed when we have time and we will let you all know before we complete the work (it is likely to require a site republish).
Russ asked about this again. Let's do it!

added 0.5 putting it live

its live! 

( and thx one of my fav. moments today was seeing the include kicking in on the chartbeat stats )
Chartbeat is now live on all pages.
Can see this – looks great Danny!

From Morag:

We have our next ticketing announcement on Tues 15 Feb.
 
We will have a splash page for this, to go up that morning (timings to be concerned, but it won’t be crack of dawn).

Update: we are awaiting the assets. If we get them before 2pm we will probably be able to get them up today, otherwise it may not be until Monday lunchtime. Given the tight time scale, we may not be able to preview them on staging in advance, but we will do our best to allow this to happen so Russ at ITS can check it. 

Russ: it looks like you should probably schedule time on Monday afternoon for this.

Kieran, could you turn of rsync on staging for the splash page and htaccess now as per your instructions at http://kitsite.net/wiki/index.php?title=Staging_environment#Example_1._Enabling.2Fdisabling_splash_page and then reassign to lars.
Done.
Sorry, when I said "done", I meant the first part is done!

I can confirm that as described in the documentati at http://postcms.zendesk.com/entries/443604-staging-environment, we have now switched off syncing of the /splash folder and the htaccess file, which will allow changes to be made and previewed on the staging environment before publishing to live.

As we have not used this process before, we will proceed with caution.

Lars, when you actually get the splash page, I suggest publishing the splash folder first to make sure it is not going to live and then when you publish the htaccess file have Kieran on hand--just in case.
Lars, can you add your time to this ticket.

Tue 15

0.1    later in the day, testing + fwding css prob to lars.

(+possibly more that I can't remember)

+ Lars 0.2

A few questions regarding our RSS feeds which we're looking at as part of our SEO strategy:

1. Is it possible to change the RSS URLs for News and Blog to the following Feedburner URLs:
http://feeds.feedburner.com/london2012/blog
http://feeds.feedburner.com/london2012/news

2. Is it possible to rename the News feed from ‘News RSS’ to ‘London 2012 News’?  (Can we do this ourselves?)

3. Would it be technically feasible to change the subscribe button to a tool similar to the one available here:
http://www.mybloglog.com/buzz/community/allfacebook/

4. Finally, is ot possible to fix the broekn images in the blog feed?  (I think this may be related to ticket #40.)

Thanks,
Andy
marking as high

Andy,
1. is done - I've republished the respective index pages (http://www.london2012.com/blog/index.php & http://www.london2012.com/news/index.php) - We'll need to publish all blog posts and news items as well.

2. I've changed the title - hope feedburner will pick it up (if not, you'll need to change the title in feedburner)

3. Technically possible. The quasi industry standard for this is http://www.addthis.com/ - but I think we had trouble having that approved previously. We can do a custom solution as well which may take some extra time.

4. Looking into this, can be tricky.

Jamie, as discussed, I've added some regexp hack to the News RSS and Blog RSS template that would fix problem no. 4.
If it breaks, remove this:

.replace(/\=\"(?!http)/g,'="http://www.london2012.com/')

Hi,

I've just noticed that the blog and news feeds are publishing URLs with double forward-slashes - as below. They seem to work ok but will impact our SEO efforts as I believe they'll be viewed as duplicate content.

http://www.london2012.com//blog/posts.rsshttp://www.london2012.com/blog/posts.rss

http://www.london2012.com//blog/2011/02/photos-of-the-week-.phphttp://www.london2012.com/blog/2011/02/photos-of-the-week-.php

 Could this be investigated please?

Regards,
Andy

Andy Watkins
New Media Project Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
Direct line: +44 (0)203 2012 736
Mobile: +44 (0)7739 574764

________________________________

Hi Andy,

Where are you seeing the urls with double slashes?

See the footers on the attached screenshots, are you seeing different urls on this page or is it another page that is displaying the issue?
http://www.london2012.com//blog/2011/02/photos-of-the-week-.php

thanks

Jamie

Hi Jamie,

I can't view your screenshots - problem with our remote access system - but the double slashes are actually published in the feeds:
http://www.london2012.com/blog/posts.rss
http://www.london2012.com/news/news.rss

Cheers,
Andy

Mobile: +44 (0)7739 574764

Ah that makes sens now, will get fixed.

Jamie

OK they're both fixed now..

Jamie

comments.value:
I note that the bberry and iphone formatted sites' "fullsite" link just goes back to the mobile site homepage and that, as of this morning, clicking a link on an external site from a bberry browser to a deep linked page on ours, e.g. from the BBC news report on the Olympic  schedule release, resolves to the mobile site  homepage

Can you investigate?



Alex Balfour
Head of New Media
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 117
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com
www.facebook.com/london2012
www.twitter.com/london2012http://www.twitter.com/london2012
wwww.youtube.com/london2012
Marking as high

Overly aggressive redirecting?

RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{HTTP_USER_AGENT} (nokia|symbian|iphone|blackberry|android) [NC] 
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} '/(index.php|)$' [NC]
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} '!/mobile' [NC]
RewriteRule (.*) /mobile/ [L]

perhaps remove the last RewriteCond?

This is fixed.
Referrals from third-party sites are now passed directly through to the correct page (rather than making the rather crude presumption that anyone with a mobile user-agent is really just looking for the mobile home-page).
Kieran

If you require any further assistance, please contact the Service Desk on 0800 731 1713 or via email to ah.support@bt.com

Regards,
BT Data Centre Services | 0800 731 1713 | ah.support@bt.com | https://www.selfcare.bt.com
